= Introduction =

This page focuses on showing you how to setup your Salesmen development environment in Eclipse.

= Eclipse =

If you have not yet installed Eclipse, here is where you can find [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ Eclipse downloads].

Immediate download links for different operating systems below:

    [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.5.1-200909170800/eclipse-SDK-3.5.1-linux-gtk.tar.gz&url=http://eclipse.mirror.kangaroot.net/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.5.1-200909170800/eclipse-SDK-3.5.1-linux-gtk.tar.gz&mirror_id=468 Linux 32bit]

    [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.5.1-200909170800/eclipse-SDK-3.5.1-win32.zip&url=http://eclipse.mirror.kangaroot.net/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.5.1-200909170800/eclipse-SDK-3.5.1-win32.zip&mirror_id=468 Windows]

    [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.5.1-200909170800/eclipse-SDK-3.5.1-macosx-carbon.tar.gz&url=http://eclipse.mirror.kangaroot.net/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.5.1-200909170800/eclipse-SDK-3.5.1-macosx-carbon.tar.gz&mirror_id=468 Mac OS X Carbon 32bit]

Once downloaded, extract this archive.
To be able to use the eclipse command anywhere, you just need to export /eclipse/bin/

Before running Eclipse, make sure you have JDK6 installed.

Run Eclipse using this command: eclipse -vm $JAVA_HOME/bin/java/

Choose a folder for Eclipse to use as workspace.

= Setup JBoss =

Arrived in Eclipse, choose Help, Install New Software.
Choose Add..., and type the following:
  Name: JBoss Tools Dev

  Location: http://download.jboss.org/jbosstools/updates/JBossTools-3.1.0.M4

Again, but now:
  Name: BIRT 2.5

  Location: http://download.eclipse.org/birt/update-site/2.5/

And again:
  Name: m2eclipse

  Location: http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/update-dev/

Now, choose JBoss Tools Dev, check everything, choose Next, Finish.

This may take some time...
